gurmukhi: ciVE su sYx s`ij kY ] su kop sUr g`ij kY ]
transliteration: Chadio Su Sain Sajj(i) Kai|| Su Kop Soor Gadj(i) Kai||
translation: Thundering and in great fury, he marched forward alongwith his army.

gurmukhi: auTY bjMqR bwij kY ] cilE surysu Bwij kY ]19]141]
transliteration: Outhai Bajantra Baaj(i) Kai|| Chadio Sures(u) Bhaaj(i) Kai||19||141||
translation: The trumpets were sounded, hearing which caused the king of gods run away.19.141.

gurmukhi: AnMq sUr sMg lY ] cilE su duMdBIn dY ]
transliteration: Anant Soor San Lai|| Chadio Su Doundbhoon Dai||
translation: Beating his drums, he marched forward taking countless warriors with him.

gurmukhi: hkwr sUrmw Bry ] iblok dyvqw fry ]20]142]
transliteration: Hakaar Soormaa Bhare|| Bilok Devtaa Dare||20||142||
translation: He called and gathered so many brave fighters, seeing whom the gods were frightened.20.142.
The king of gods trembled and reated all his painful circumstances to Lord Shiva.
When he gave out all his feflections, Shiva asked him about the number of his warriors.21.143.
(He further asked him) to make friends all others through all possible means;

gurmukhi: jwN qy su mwie ] jIqY bnwie ]22]144]
transliteration: Jaan Te Su Maae|| Jeetai Banaae||22||144||
translation: So that the victory of the mother of the world is assured.22.144.
Bring out all your powers, and send them in the war;
So that they may go before enemies and in great rage destroy them.23.145.
The wise gods did as advised;
And sent their boundless powers from amoungst themselves to the battlefield.24.146.
